key_points: Intermountain Healthcare will require all caregivers to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 due to pending federal rules.
Federal requirements state that Medicare and Medicaid will only cover services from health care providers with fully vaccinated employees.
Dr. Mark Briesacher, chief physician executive, says this step is necessary to continue caring for patients with federal health insurance.
Approximately 80% of Intermountain's care providers are already fully vaccinated.
Employees may seek exemptions for medical or religious reasons, similar to other vaccination requirements.
Unvaccinated employees without exemptions face administrative leave starting Jan. 5, and potential separation from the organization by Feb. 9.
It's unclear how many employees may choose to quit or be fired rather than comply with the vaccine mandate.
Other healthcare providers in Utah, including University of Utah Health, have already required employee vaccinations.
President Joe Biden announced federal vaccination requirements in September, affecting healthcare providers and large employers.
Utah Legislature cannot effectively intervene due to the federal funding Intermountain Healthcare receives.
spokespersons: Dr. Mark Briesacher (Chief Physician Executive, Intermountain Healthcare)
